title: Ariana Grande Kept Cynthia Erivoâ€™s Elphaba Ears
description: The unusual keepsake commemorates the friendship forged on the Wicked set.
author: Sabina Graves
excerpt: The unusual keepsake commemorates the friendship forged on the Wicked set.
text: Being in Wicked was a life-long dream come true for Ariana Grande, who plays Glinda in the feature adaptation of the hit Broadway musical. Getting to be part of the world has been huge for her, so it makes sense that she kept some souvenirs from the set to remember the experienceâ€¦ including a key prop that helped transform Cynthia Erivo into Elphaba. For anyone on the internet who has been holding space for the friendship between Grande and Erivo, the duo has talked about their matching â€œfor goodâ€ and poppy tattoos as part of all the ways they have expressed their love for one another like the real life Glinda and Elphie they are. Recently a new addition to their bestie lore has been revealed: Grande does actually have in her possession Erivoâ€™s prosthetic ears from the shoot. In Grandeâ€™s recent interview with BBC Radio 1, the Oscar nominee confirmed it, and revealed where exactly she keeps her odd keepsake of a piece of Elphabaâ€™s body. â€œSo right now theyâ€™re just next to the printer, like with like pens and printer and then like Cynthiaâ€™s ears.â€ (The props were made to cover the piercings on Erivoâ€™s her real ears.) â€œBut sometimes if Iâ€™m having guests over, if I put out a tray of whatever, Iâ€™ll just kind of leave them nearby to see if anyone gets a little confused.â€ Grande quickly interjected, â€œIâ€™m just kidding, Iâ€™ve never done that, but I will. No, yeah, theyâ€™re next to the printer for now. Framing them is weird.â€ It makes us wonder what Erivo might have kept of Glindaâ€™s from the film, and if itâ€™s as much of a choice as Grandeâ€™s trinkets. Friends honor each other in so many unique ways and the way the duo gush over each other is a tribute to their love of their WickedÂ characters. The interview with Grande goes on to discuss one of her favorite moments during the shoot: when Erivo winked at Grande during the filmâ€™s pivotal â€œDefying Gravityâ€ performance to help anchor the actress in Glindaâ€™s strength. It nearly broke Grande out of character, but she held it togetherâ€”â€Itâ€™s a very emotional moment,â€ Grande said of that powerful and affirming gestureâ€”and director Jon M. Chu kept it in the final cut. â€œI think itâ€™s very hard to say goodbye to someone that you love. And I think in that moment, weâ€™re both breaking. And I think the wink was so generous and warm because I think she knows how hard it is for Glinda to open up and cry and to become emotional like that,â€ Grande said. â€œThatâ€™s why Iâ€™m trying so hard not to, and Iâ€™m crying throughâ€”Iâ€™m smiling through theâ€”and Iâ€™m trying notâ€” Iâ€™m holding back and sheâ€™s just like, â€˜Iâ€™ve got you, itâ€™s okay.'â€ Grande continued, â€œAnd I think thatâ€™s what is so beautiful about â€˜Defying Gravityâ€™ is that itâ€™s the true example of unconditional love. It is saying to someone, â€˜I recognize that we can no longer grow together. We have to grow apart and I want that for you because I know itâ€™s right and best for you but it just isnâ€™t right and best for me. Weâ€™ve got this.â€™ And the wink is such aâ€”itâ€™s such a loud way of saying that.â€ Watch the rest of the interview below: Wicked is out now in theaters and on digital.Â Wicked: For GoodÂ opens this Thanksgiving. Being in Wicked was a life-long dream come true for Ariana Grande, who plays Glinda in the feature adaptation of the hit Broadway musical. Getting to be part of the world has been huge for her, so it makes sense that she kept some souvenirs from the set to remember the experienceâ€¦ including a key prop that helped transform Cynthia Erivo into Elphaba.

For anyone on the internet who has been holding space for the friendship between Grande and Erivo, the duo has talked about their matching â€œfor goodâ€ and poppy tattoos as part of all the ways they have expressed their love for one another like the real life Glinda and Elphie they are. Recently a new addition to their bestie lore has been revealed: Grande does actually have in her possession Erivoâ€™s prosthetic ears from the shoot.

In Grandeâ€™s recent interview with BBC Radio 1, the Oscar nominee confirmed it, and revealed where exactly she keeps her odd keepsake of a piece of Elphabaâ€™s body. â€œSo right now theyâ€™re just next to the printer, like with like pens and printer and then like Cynthiaâ€™s ears.â€ (The props were made to cover the piercings on Erivoâ€™s her real ears.) â€œBut sometimes if Iâ€™m having guests over, if I put out a tray of whatever, Iâ€™ll just kind of leave them nearby to see if anyone gets a little confused.â€

Grande quickly interjected, â€œIâ€™m just kidding, Iâ€™ve never done that, but I will. No, yeah, theyâ€™re next to the printer for now. Framing them is weird.â€

It makes us wonder what Erivo might have kept of Glindaâ€™s from the film, and if itâ€™s as much of a choice as Grandeâ€™s trinkets. Friends honor each other in so many unique ways and the way the duo gush over each other is a tribute to their love of their WickedÂ characters.

The interview with Grande goes on to discuss one of her favorite moments during the shoot: when Erivo winked at Grande during the filmâ€™s pivotal â€œDefying Gravityâ€ performance to help anchor the actress in Glindaâ€™s strength. It nearly broke Grande out of character, but she held it togetherâ€”â€Itâ€™s a very emotional moment,â€ Grande said of that powerful and affirming gestureâ€”and director Jon M. Chu kept it in the final cut.

â€œI think itâ€™s very hard to say goodbye to someone that you love. And I think in that moment, weâ€™re both breaking. And I think the wink was so generous and warm because I think she knows how hard it is for Glinda to open up and cry and to become emotional like that,â€ Grande said. â€œThatâ€™s why Iâ€™m trying so hard not to, and Iâ€™m crying throughâ€”Iâ€™m smiling through theâ€”and Iâ€™m trying notâ€” Iâ€™m holding back and sheâ€™s just like, â€˜Iâ€™ve got you, itâ€™s okay.'â€

Grande continued, â€œAnd I think thatâ€™s what is so beautiful about â€˜Defying Gravityâ€™ is that itâ€™s the true example of unconditional love. It is saying to someone, â€˜I recognize that we can no longer grow together. We have to grow apart and I want that for you because I know itâ€™s right and best for you but it just isnâ€™t right and best for me. Weâ€™ve got this.â€™ And the wink is such aâ€”itâ€™s such a loud way of saying that.â€
